title: How to Make Lasagna with Red Wine

methods.name: Making the Sauce for Your Lasagna

steps.headline: Dice one medium onion.
steps.description: Sauté in 2 Tbsp. butter, along with 1/2 Tbsp. minced garlic. Remove from pan.

steps.headline: Fry 1-1/2 Lbs.
steps.description: ground chuck on high heat. Break up meat with a masher. Drain in colander using the same masher to squeeze out any fat. Return meat to pan and add onion/garlic. Stir.

steps.headline: Into this mixture add a palm full each of dried parsley, chervil and basil.
Now add Worcestershire sauce and A-1 sauce, along with about 1/2 cup of red wine.
Combine meat mixture with 1 jar of Classico Tomato and Basil Pasta Sauce.
steps.description: Swish the jar with about 1/2 cup water. Put watery mixture into pot. Simmer on very low heat.

steps.headline: While the sauce simmers, complete the following:
steps.description:
Mix together: 1 - 1# container of small curd cottage cheese, 2 eggs, 1 cup Parmesan cheese, and a palm full of dried parsley. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cf\/Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cf\/Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Have ready 1 box of lasagna noodles (no-boil), 2 - 8 oz. packages shredded Mozzarella cheese, 1 - 8 oz. package of shredded Parmesan/Romano cheese, and 1 - 8 oz. package shredded sharp Cheddar cheese. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Start by spreading 1 cup of sauce on the bottom of a 9 x 12 cake pan.
Next add a layer of lasagna noodles and 1/3 of the sauce.
Now spread 1/3 of the cottage cheese mixture, followed by 1/3 of the white cheeses.
Continue building until you run out of supplies.
steps.description: Top the lasagna off with the remaining cheeses, including the 8 oz. of cheddar cheese.

steps.headline: Bake at 350 degrees for about an hour.

text:
Making the Sauce for Your Lasagna Dice one medium onion. Sauté in 2 Tbsp. butter, along with 1/2 Tbsp. minced garlic. Remove from pan. Fry 1-1/2 Lbs. ground chuck on high heat. Break up meat with a masher. Drain in colander using the same masher to squeeze out any fat. Return meat to pan and add onion/garlic. Stir. Into this mixture add a palm full each of dried parsley, chervil and basil. Stir. Now add Worcestershire sauce and A-1 sauce, along with about 1/2 cup of red wine. Stir thoroughly. Combine meat mixture with 1 jar of Classico Tomato and Basil Pasta Sauce. Swish the jar with about 1/2 cup water. Put watery mixture into pot. Simmer on very low heat. While the sauce simmers, complete the following: Mix together: 1 - 1# container of small curd cottage cheese, 2 eggs, 1 cup Parmesan cheese, and a palm full of dried parsley. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cf\/Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cf\/Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Have ready 1 box of lasagna noodles (no-boil), 2 - 8 oz. packages shredded Mozzarella cheese, 1 - 8 oz. package of shredded Parmesan/Romano cheese, and 1 - 8 oz. package shredded sharp Cheddar cheese. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Build Your Lasagna Start by spreading 1 cup of sauce on the bottom of a 9 x 12 cake pan. Next add a layer of lasagna noodles and 1/3 of the sauce. Now spread 1/3 of the cottage cheese mixture, followed by 1/3 of the white cheeses. Continue building until you run out of supplies. Top the lasagna off with the remaining cheeses, including the 8 oz. of cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about an hour. Finished.
sentences: Making the Sauce for Your Lasagna Dice one medium onion.
Sauté in 2 Tbsp.
butter, along with 1/2 Tbsp.
minced garlic.
Remove from pan.
Fry 1-1/2 Lbs.
ground chuck on high heat.
Break up meat with a masher.
Drain in colander using the same masher to squeeze out any fat.
Return meat to pan and add onion/garlic.
Stir.
Into this mixture add a palm full each of dried parsley, chervil and basil.
Stir.
Now add Worcestershire sauce and A-1 sauce, along with about 1/2 cup of red wine.
Stir thoroughly.
Combine meat mixture with 1 jar of Classico Tomato and Basil Pasta Sauce.
Swish the jar with about 1/2 cup water.
Put watery mixture into pot.
Simmer on very low heat.
While the sauce simmers, complete the following: Mix together:  1 - 1# container of small curd cottage cheese, 2 eggs, 1 cup Parmesan cheese, and a palm full of dried parsley.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cf\/Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cf\/Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Have ready 1 box of lasagna noodles (no-boil), 2 - 8 oz.
packages shredded Mozzarella cheese, 1 - 8 oz.
package of shredded Parmesan/Romano cheese, and 1 - 8 oz.
package shredded sharp Cheddar cheese.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-%22Really-Good%22-Lasagna-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Build Your Lasagna Start by spreading 1 cup of sauce on the bottom of a 9 x 12 cake pan.
Next add a layer of lasagna noodles and 1/3 of the sauce.
Now spread 1/3 of the cottage cheese mixture, followed by 1/3 of the white cheeses.
Continue building until you run out of supplies.
Top the lasagna off with the remaining cheeses, including the 8 oz.
of cheddar cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for about an hour.
Finished.
